entry.title: 534: Blame the Automation
entry.summary: Azure suffers a big outage, and Microsoft blames faulty automation; why we think there might be early signs of weak demand for Apple's Vision Pro and more.

entry.title: 526: Canonical Wins by Default
entry.summary: While chaos is brewing in SUSE and Red Hat land, Canonical stays the course and doubles down on the Linux desktop. Plus, our thoughts on the kernel team GPL-blocking NVIDIA.

entry.title: 533: Critical Failure in Open Source
entry.summary: U.S. officials are warning open-source software could be a cyber security threat. Their solution? Money. But do we want them picking the winners and losers of open source? Plus, Mike's thoughts after using Cursor AI and a Cornell study take generated code to the shed.

entry.title: 525: Beating Apple to the Sauce
entry.summary: We daily drive Asahi Linux on a MacBook, chat about how the team beat Apple to a major GPU milestone, and an easy way to self-host open-source ChatGPT alternatives. Special Guest: Neal Gompa.

entry.title: 532: Take It to the Limit
entry.summary: Mike hits the limits of ChatGPT's knowledge, a chat about editors and what we'd do for a living if it had to be outside of tech.

entry.title: 524: How Our Server Got It's Groove Back
entry.summary: Can we build an indestructible server that stands up to the test of giving out root login to the Internet?

entry.title: 531: C# as it Should Have Been
entry.summary: Java developers are getting the Oracle shakedown, openAI is running out of money, and more.

entry.title: 523: Ride the Rhino
entry.summary: We're trying out Rhino Linuxâ€”a unique take on rolling Ubuntu with AUR-like powers and other surprises.
